com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.core

Class JRoutine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gh.bmd.jrt.core.JRoutine
      • com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.core.JRoutine
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JRoutine, JRoutine

    public class JRoutine
extends JRoutine
    This utility class extends the base Java routine in order to support additional routine builders specific to the Android platform.
    Routine invocations created through the returned builder will be execute inside a service specified through the routine builder. Be aware, though, that the invocation results will be dispatched in the specified looper, so that, waiting for the outputs on the very same looper thread, immediately after its invocation, will result in a deadlock.
    By default output results are dispatched in the main looper.

    Note that it is up to the caller to properly declare the service in the manifest file. Note also that it is possible to manage the service lifecycle starting it through the Context.startService(android.content.Intent) method. Normally the service will stay active only during a routine invocation.
    The service can be also made run in a different process, however, in such case, the data passed through the routine input and output channels must comply with the Parcel.writeValue(Object) method. Be aware though, that issues may arise when employing Serializable objects on the Lollipop OS version, so, it is advisable to use Parcelable objects instead.

    For example, in order to get a resource from the network, needed to fill an activity UI: 

         

         @Override
         protected void onCreate(final Bundle savedInstanceState) {

             super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
             setContentView(R.layout.my_activity_layout);

             final Routine<URI, MyResource> routine =
                     JRoutine.onService(this, ClassToken.tokenOf(LoadResourceUri.class))
                             .buildRoutine();
             routine.callAsync(RESOURCE_URI)
                    .bind(new TemplateOutputConsumer<MyResource>() {

                        @Override
                        public void onError(@Nullable final Throwable error) {

                            displayError(error);
                        }

                        @Override
                        public void onOutput(final MyResource resource) {

                            displayResource(resource);
                        }
                    });
         }

    Created by davide-maestroni on 1/8/15.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ServiceObjectRoutineBuilder onService(Context context, Class<?> targetClass)
      Returns a builder of routines running in a service based on the specified context, wrapping the specified object instances.
      In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as the invocation service.
      static <INPUT,OUTPUT> 
      ServiceRoutineBuilder<INPUT,OUTPUT>      		 onService(Context context, ClassToken<? extends ContextInvocation<INPUT,OUTPUT>> classToken)
      Returns a builder of routines running in a service based on the specified context.
      In order to customize the invocation creation, the caller must override the method RoutineService.getInvocationFactory(Class).

    • Method Detail

      • onService

        @Nonnull
public static <INPUT,OUTPUT> ServiceRoutineBuilder<INPUT,OUTPUT> onService(@Nonnull
                                                                   Context context,
                                                                   @Nonnull
                                                                   ClassToken<? extends ContextInvocation<INPUT,OUTPUT>> classToken)
        Returns a builder of routines running in a service based on the specified context.
        In order to customize the invocation creation, the caller must override the method RoutineService.getInvocationFactory(Class).

        Note that the built routine results will be dispatched in the looper specified through the builder, thus, waiting for the outputs on the very same looper thread, immediately after its invocation, will result in a deadlock.
        By default output results are dispatched in the main looper.

        Type Parameters:
        INPUT - the input data type.
        OUTPUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        context - the routine context.
        classToken - the invocation class token.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.

      • onService

        @Nonnull
public static ServiceObjectRoutineBuilder onService(@Nonnull
                                            Context context,
                                            @Nonnull
                                            Class<?> targetClass)
        Returns a builder of routines running in a service based on the specified context, wrapping the specified object instances.
        In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as the invocation service.

        Note that the built routine results will be dispatched in the looper specified through the builder, thus, waiting for the outputs on the very same looper thread, immediately after its invocation, will result in a deadlock.
        By default output results are dispatched in the main looper.

        Parameters:
        context - the routine context.
        targetClass - the wrapped object class.
        Returns:
        the routine builder instance.
